The audio guided tour was well planned and the stories told interesting and gave a real feeling of what it was like. Great views back to San Francisco and of the Golden Gate Bridge too. Well woth...


More  



We booked in advance to make sure that we were able to get onto the tour although on the day it seemed like there was plenty of space for people to show up and come on the tour. The tours leave every half hour and the boat across to the island is quite large and can take a number of...


More  



We were able to get tickets very easily. The line was short; but that is probably due to being there in the down (winter) season. The ride to Alcatraz was quick & comfortable. We had to ride on the upper deck because people filled in the indoors section. There was a light rain so the seats were wet. But I...


More  



Visited San Francisco in June 2015 and the Alcatraz cruise was definitely worth it. My husband, 22 year old daughter and I went together and we were all completely fascinated by the audio tour. I highly recommend this experience.

My wife and I and another couple were in San Francisco for one day at the end of a cruise in November so we decided beforehand to take a cruise over to Alcatraz. We booked through Alcatraz Cruises because they are the only official ticket vendor for Alcatraz. Buying from somebody else means you are paying more to ride on...


More  



Amazing service, easy to find, ferry was fast, stable and clean. The boats ran on time and we really enjoyed the ride and alcatraz at the other end

Don't bother buying tickets from any other tour operator as basically you'll be paying more to go with these guys, who are the only people allowed to land people. There's a fab exhibition up in the new industries building showing pics/bio of convicted criminals

This is the only official ticket vendor for Alcatraz; so save yourself a headache and just buy from them. Was impressed with the efficiency they used to get people on and off the boat. There is also an abundance of return times to SF so you don't feel stuck.

Very interesting and educational. The audio tour is very well structured and keeps you hooked. The view on the bay is breathtaking.

We had a full day to spend in the city, and after making our own city tour (had a rental car), we decided to book this Alcatraz tour. In traversing the bay area, you cannot help but see the small island from various vantage points. The tours were booked-up, but we were placed on the waiting list for the evening...


More

title: Red and White Fleet, San Francisco
address: Pier 43 1/2, Historic Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco, CA 94133
review_list:
If you are short on time, but want to take in as many attractions as possible, then the 60 minute Golden Gate Bridge cruise is perfect. The boat ride takes you out to the bridge, then around Alcatraz Island while giving you some great back ground stories and information. The $30 price tag is a great bargain. Next time we're...


More  



We were on the last cruise of the day in mid January. For photographers, just know that this means the bridge and area is perfect for photography at that time. We were given individual headsets that you can set to your native language. very helpful and informative. We actually stayed on the front of the boat for most of the...


More  



We did the twilight cruise and WOW the city looks so beautiful at night was well worth it you sail out to the Golden gate bridge then back past Alcatraz which is very very creepy at night then you sail past the city towards and under bay bridge they provide food and entertainment the food was good it was a...


More  



I bought the 1 1/2 boat tour (blue line). Very great price $37.00 per person. We took the last tour of the day. Friendly, clean, and organized. A gentleman on the boat offer to take photos (forgot to get his name). The boat slows down for better view. Headphones and a audio were given for personal tours in English, Thai,...


More  



Less than $40.00 and an hour and a half ferry ride to see the city from a boat in the bay, sign me up again! You literally get to go from GG bridge to the BA bridge, and you'll get to take some remarkable photos. First time CA visitor, my first stop was Fisherman's Wharf, and I had a couple...


More  



We took the Alcatraz tour which did not put us ON the island, but circled around it, with a very interesting narrative. What a great way to spend an hour and a half, learning about the city and the prison and getting some sightseeing done as well. This made our SF GoCard worth it!

We took the Golden Gate Bay Cruise, and we really enjoyed this tour, you get a really close view of Alcatraz (in case you aren't planning to go inside), and they take you under the Golden Gate as well. It's also very informative if you are not familiar with the history of the city. Totally recommend it! (We were able...


More  



The ferry cruise itself was actually good and informative! Too bad the weather was very foggy and rainy at the same time. The crews were very friendly and they helped everyone with taking pictures.
If the weather is good, it is totally recommended to do the bridge-to-bridge cruise!

Took the basic 1-hour cruise from Fisherman's Wharf out under the Bridge and back around Alcatraz. Good audio commentary on headsets (multiple language options included) with interesting background to the history of the area. Recommended for any visit to the city.

Did 1 hour cruise that went under golden gate bridge. View of golden gate from cruise is amazing. I found commentary precise and very informative.

title: Avital Food Tours, San Francisco
review_list:
I've lived in the Bay Area for almost 20 years and learned new things on this tour about the area. Ida was awesome! So much energy and knowledge. She was engaging and was very good at getting everyone to mingle. Food was good as well - an opportunity to go outside of the normal circuit and try something new.

I have been on Avital's Food Tours 5 times now! I bring out of town friends, board members and even folks that live in San Francisco. Avital's tours are a fun-filled three hours, walking historic neighborhoods in San Fran, learning fun facts about the city, and enjoying delicious foods at different restaurants and bars. Meeting the chefs/owners of different establishments...


More  



Our group, led by Ida, went on the Mission District Food Tour. She took us through an eclectic range of food, including: US cheeses, Mexican and caramel salted ice cream. We also stopped at the Bi Rite Market. The Market is a neat little store jammed to the rafters with a selection that outweighs its size. It is worth seeing...


More  



Leila was an amazing tour guide. She's clearly very connected to the city (5th generation San Franciscan!) and knows all of its quirky history and anecdotes. She was very passionate and knowledgeable

Really enjoyed Ida's tour leadeship skills. Would stongly suggest the tour to all our friends just to discover to few new places in the city that might be overlooked. Best part of the tour (besides Ida) was the stop at Hog & Rocks. It had a good vibe and atmosphere, the manager (or owner) took the time to come out...


More  



Anna did a fantastic job in providing a food tour in the SF Mission District. She was extremely knowledgeable and engaging where she actively helped everyone participate!
Thank you Anna!

Great way to discover a new neighborhood, meet new people of course try amazing and diverse food. Margherita was so fun and attentive to everyone, the selection of restaurants was very thoughtful and although I am usually pretty picky (and even more so now when I am pregnant) I enjoyed everything I tried. I also appreciated how they took my...


More  



This was a great tour. Learned so much about the mission, it's history and food. Anna was a excellent guide and all the spots we visited were top notch - West of Pecos, Mission Cheese, Gracias Madre, and Bi-rite Market and Creamery (who knew? Not me, I would have strolled right by - a fascinating little Market packed full of...


More  



loved it--this was a great team building experience for our 10-person creative team--good mix of food, drink and Mission culture

To begin Mrs.Margherita herself is the most awesome tour guide! She really has a passion for this area and its food!

disappointed! Our guide was very good and knew a lot about Chinatown and told us lots of interesting stories. We really enjoyed the places we visited, places you wouldn't really go if you didn't know the area. We were only...

The walking was very easy around the area and Blandina was so knowledgeable and likeable we felt as if we had known her for years. The food was...

Blondina's enthusiasm for her community was evident from her close relationships with the restaurant owners and local artisans that we visited and in her interesting and quirky stories about the area's history and current appeal. More  



North Beach/Little Italy Food Tour: Excellent tour! The tour guide was on time (start and finish) and very informative about the area (I believe he grew up there). I'll definitely join them for other tours when I'm back in the area.

My friends surprised me with this for my 50th birthday. I have lived in the Bay Area all my life and never did this. What a spectacular time we had! Blandina was over the top gracious, knowledgeable and personable. Thanks for the bday dessert, candle and song at the end of our dinner. I can't wait to do another tour...

I would highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting San Francisco. Our tour guide Blandina was an excellent source of information and lots of fun as well. I have done this tour 4 times with friends when they visit San Francisco. This year I took my office staff and they loved it! Great tour, food and guides.

title: Sidewalk Food Tours of San Francisco, San Francisco
review_list:
Spent 3 hours yesterday on a North Beach trip with Sidewalk Food Tours. My hostess, Jamie, is an effervescent woman filled with knowledge about the historic North Beach neighborhood.
The tour was fun and the 3 hours passed quickly. We sampled tasty food at Molinari Delicatessen, U.S. Restaurant, Pena Pachamama and XOX Truffles. The group ended at Caffe Roma for...


More  



Adrienne was amazing for the Chinatown food tour! Food was delish and the history was awesome too. Even for a local like me it was fantastic. It's a must when visiting the city. My husband and I will gladly do another sidewalk tour!

i grew up in san francisco,it was nice to learn about my home town. the day with Adrienne was so fun. and the food was so good and so much of it. don't eat breakfast. i learned so much along the way. Adrienne has a way of giving information that you can remember.
I'm looking forward to the mission tour...


More  



We did our Chinatown Sidewalk Food Tour on a Saturday morning in a small group of 5. Elaine was our tour guide and she did an excellent job of leading us, giving us enough history of Chinatown and keeping on time and task. She even used a timer to make sure she was staying on time! We started the tour...


More  



My mom and I took the Mission District tour with Brian and really enjoyed our time. Brian was filled with local information and gave a lot of context about the neighborhood as well as San Francisco from its early days. I learned so much about the City I hadn't known before even though I have visited San Francisco several times....


More  



Guide Brian spouted off some 'obscure' SF history that we (who grew up in SF) didn't know about. Thanks!! Not sure about what to expect, but happy with all offerings and even with a surprise musical performance at a Bolivian vegan restaurant (although hoping for one stop for pizza on this tour!). We went on the North Beach food tour with Brian and had a great time. The food was plentiful and delicious. The food stops were mostly Italian with the most amazing Italian sandwich, pasta, meatballs and the best cannot we've ever tasted. Wonderful afternoon eating, learning and socializing. Highly recommended!

After reading all the reviews we were excited for the tour. In the end we were disappointed . The first two stops were good the third was a vegan Bolivian restaurant where the owner talked for 40 minutes telling her life story.

This was one of the highlights of our recent trip to San Francisco. We highly recommend it. Adrienne was charming and knowledgable, the food was great and we loved all the extra things we did and learned.

title: Beach Blanket Babylon, San Francisco
address: 678 Beach Blanket Babylon Boulevard (Green Street), Club Fugazi, San Francisco, CA
review_list:
An irreverent, zany, fun-filled musical spoof that stands the test of time. Continually updated to reflect the latest events in pop culture. We've taken ALL our out-of-town visitors and family members here, with everyone giving rave reviews & still talking about it. Phenomenal singing, dazzling costumes, fabulous performances across the board, & loads of laughs. Even without visitors, we go...


More  



What a show! You don't want to miss this. Make the effort to add this to your itinerary for your trip in San Francisco. Beautiful old theater and a wonderful show that had me laughing all night!

My boyfriend and I (we are 45 & 53) took the advice of a local and saw this show while visiting SF. I've never seen a show so positively reviewed and now I know why! It was truly a highlight of our trip and we laughed through the whole show. Our cheeks hurt when it was over! It was current,...


More  



This cabaret is an absolute blast. Sit and listen to stories of San Francisco and issues in the United States as you sip wine. You will leave laughing with big smiles.

A must see for anyone visiting San Francisco who enjoys pop culture and satire. Delightful, fast-paced and hilarious. Updated regularly - included Bernie Sanders, Palin and Trump characters. We try to go every year. Arrive early to get a good seat.

We had a great time, eventhough we were furthest away from the stage the view was good, and the sound was loud enough. (VERY loud) It was fun and relevant and up to date

Nobody is spared in this satirical comedy at Club Fugazi in the North Beach district of SF. Politicians, movie stars, singers, athletes, world leaders, you name it, there is a skit about it.
The show keeps up a good pace and the laughs keep coming.
The performers are pretty versatile, singing, dancing, even flying out to the audience at one...


More  



This is an experience not to be missed if at all possible! Such an extravaganza and tons of fun to be had.

We saw Steve Silver's Beach Blanket Babylon last night, and it was fabulous. My daughter got us tickets as a Christmas present, and I am glad she did as I probably would not have gone otherwise. We are now a fan, and cannot wait to go back for another performance. If you love comedy, especially satire, you will love Beach...


More  



This show has been running in SF for years. It is a series of parody-type songs and dances, and It is great, great fun. title: San Francisco Playhouse, San Francisco
address: 450 Post Street, 2nd Floor, San Francisco, CA 94102
review_list:
Excellent performance of a challenging play. Audience invited to post performance discussion with actors. A memorable evening.

If one is willing to spend wonderful time in San Francisco - and it is an amazing city to visit - you should go to the playhouse. You will enter a small theater, but it has that feeling of true art. The play I have seen was really well made which makes me believe the people who work there are...


More  



The experience from buying tix to leaving the play was great. The people were friendly and helpful. Stage Kiss was well done and entertaining.

I would give the playhouse 6 stars if possible! I booked a last minute pair of tickets for my girlfriend's birthday and the theatre bent over backwards to make the play an absolutely amazing experience.
First, they helped accommodate some last minute requests. Second, the play was absolutely hilarious (it was Stage Kiss--a play within a play within a play)....


More  



Stage Kiss is a brilliant concept and works well on several levels, from outright slapstick and commedia del'arte style, to satire of pretentious theater and of romantic love, to compelling drama. It was never dull or slow. It continues the SF Playhouse traditions of offering new and compelling plays that are insightful, well done, and well acted.

Stage Kiss is an amusing play which was delightfully executed. The stagecraft was well thought out and it worked. This is a beautiful old theatre which is supported by a number of dedicated volunteers. This was theatre at its best. VERY WELL DONE.

The SF Playhouse Productions are of the finest quality Theater and provides the Best Value for Theater Entertainment that You will experience...

Always love going to SF Playhouse. Some play are better than others, but am rarely disappointed. Stage Kiss is hilarious and extremely well-performed. A real actors' workout!

We had three days in San Francisco and wanted to see a show/ play/ musical. Searched around and found "Stage Kiss". It is an interesting location, and you enter the theatre through a hotel lobby. We went up to the mezzanine, and our front row seats there gave us an excellent view (they are a lot cheaper than the stalls!)....


More  



A great place to see a play and you won't be disappointed. From the history of this theater to the amazing actor's! Definitely a must if you want a special evening out in SF.

As being Dutch, for us a bicycle tour is nothing special. But it when Robbert guides you trough San Francisco and over the Golden Gate! Very interesting stories and background, amazing views, culture and nature and a lot of laughs. It was really great. Go back with the boat, sit and relax and enjoy the view again. Super!

Service was good and quick. Rentin the bike was expensive, considering it was off season (34 USD + insurance)

We had an amazing time with Robert as our guide. The tour is great for beginner riders like myself and is stil very enjoyable for experienced riders like my husband. The sites and scenery is breathtaking, but Our guide Robert really added a lot to the tour. Can't say enough wonderful things about our experience. We highly recommend it. Great...

My wife and I hired a push bike to ride from Fishermans Wharf to Sausalito, crossing the Golden Gate Bridge. It is a fun ride, a few hills but a mostly easy ride. We than caught the ferry back. There is plenty of places to stop for pictures and views. I would recommend this ride to anyone. The bikes that...

We had a fantastic time on our bike tour over the bridge.
we rode a tandem bike as i am a little nervous on the road.
our guide jim was brillant very informative and we would advise anyone to take this tour,
don't let the miles you cover put you off i managed it easily and i am knocking on...

We met three different people at the desk, first one, Dieter, made a good impression of the service and tour options and gave us advice about nearby sights and coupon for a food place. Bikes are a good way to get around SF on those up-and-down streets.

Thanks to James for a great day on the bikes riding up to and over the Golden Gate Bridge today - was exactly what I was expecting and more :)
Flexible tour which was great having done the Segway yesterday - took us to the ex-military base right under the bridge where the famous GoldenGate surfers are - amazing to...

I hope this is the correct bike rental place. We rented bikes from here on christmas day. I was a bit weary because it was 5 miles each way, for a total of 10 miles. I am not a huge bike rider, but do zumba 3-4 times a week, so I thought I would be ok. So the 3 of...

This was quite a long bike ride, but I totally enjoyed every minute of it. Once we got on to the bridge I was whaling like I was at a concert!! Man the views were breath taking. I would recommend this tour, but be sure you've got a lot of leg strength for those hills!!

title: Blazing Saddles Bike Rentals and Tours, San Francisco
review_list:
My wife and I were in San Francisco for the Super Bowl 50 festivities.We rented two bikes and did the 8.1 mile ride over the Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito. It was a warm, sunny day, perfect for a bike ride. We took the ferry back from Sausalito. Very easy and efficient. The Bay Area is very bike friendly, couldn't...


More  



Hired two bikes plus a baby seat and had an awesome day. Staff uber enthusiastic about us riding the bridge! They were all super nice and the whole set up very professional and easy to get going safely.

A bike ride along the shore of the Bay Area in San Francisco is surprisingly easy. My son and I were looking for something a bit different to previous trips. Blazing Saddles have a LOT of bikes and after a short briefing video were back out on the streets in about 10 minutes. Plenty of different bikes to choose from...


More  



We had booked a bike tour of San Francisico, but it was cancelled due to bad weather. A couple of days later, when the weather had improved, we decided that we really wanted to bike the bridge, so we went to Blazing Saddles and hired a tandem. They make you watch a safety video first, but it is quite useful...


More  



Our family of 5 enjoyed the service of Blazing Saddles. They were were efficient and fun to deal with. Lots of information, so all we had to do was get on the bikes and pedal. Would definitely recommend this company for a great cycling experience.

had the most amazing day today cycling over the golden gate bridge. an absolute must! can not recommend blazing saddles enough. lots of information before you set off and also had a video to watch and tickets for our return journey back on the ferry which made it all so easy.

During my stay in San Francisco I came across several bike rental businesses but I opted to reserve a bike from Blazing Saddles because they offered electric bikes at a reasonable price. Booking online saved me 20% off which was great. The staff were very helpful and the bike was in pretty good condition. I also really liked a short...

This past December I went on bike tour across the Golden Gate from the Hyde location. It was a great tour with Alex and Kyle, who shared all kinds of interesting historical facts along the way. Friendly service & good bikes. They helped us out with the route, made suggestions and answered our questions. We did an all day rental, and picked up the bikes down by the wharf. There's a lot of choices for bikes rentals, but this one seems to work out pretty well.

Awesome thing to do in the Wharf area. Cheaper than cab and you get gift card 4 sporting good store.

Great service, good bikes. It was easy to find and my husband got 'for free' those mountain biking shoes he wanted. Everyone was happy!

For the price of a days bike hire for the family, we picked up some trainers and cycling kit for free. Fantastic value.

Great bikes and very comfortable saddles. The free concept is a great idea. We stopped at the sports store on the way past and picked up some 'skins' for effectively $20 which was very cheap! They cycle to the bridge is great and a must do.

Hired two bikes plus a baby seat and had an awesome day. Staff uber enthusiastic about us riding the bridge! They were all super nice and the whole set up very professional and easy to get going safely.

title: San Francisco Love Tours, San Francisco
address: 2899 Hyde Street, corner of Hyde & Jefferson Street on the Aquatic Park side, San Francisco, CA 94109
review_list:
We took this tour in December 2015 when we were in SF. The bus is decorated in the hippie style seen in the pictures. The tour is great, taking you closer to popular tourist attractions than the open top bus can get to, such as the Golden gate Bridge. The tour is personable and intimate. As the bus tours around...


More  



We took a two hour tour with Derek as our guide. It was fun being in a flower decorated VW van, and we lucked out and had the van (Sunshine) all to ourselves. Derek was very informative and friendly. We are so glad we passed up the big tour companies and opted for a more personal experience.

The vehicle, the image, the style for this tour fits in SF so perfectly. Can't go wrong in the lovely era-decorated VW bus! And the guide was fantastic, humorous, informative, personable, relaxed atmosphere. Took us in spots where no other tours go. Thumbs up all around!

Fab tour can't fault it. We went in August with our 9 yr old son who loved it too!
You get to see lots of areas you wouldn't on a regular larger tour bus. Great fun!
Have recommended you to my brother who's visiting in April 16 also from the UK.

We took the 2-hour tour in Sunshine (the hand-painted 1977 Kombi van) with Debora as our guide. She was as individual as the van but was a great fund of knowledge, fun facts and cheerfulness, matching the vibe of the tour perfectly. Beginning near Fisherman's Wharf, right at the end of the Powell-Hyde St cable car route by Aquatic Park,...


More  



Worth every penny...great 2 hrs in hip VW bus which tourists were snapping pics of us in! Allan, the owner, turned a rainy grey day into info packed, but not canned, tour of this great city-able to venture into areas larger tour vans & buses can't go. Thank you Allan for a great time & great memories of San Francisco!

We only had 2 days to spend in San Francisco, so the Love Tour was perfect for us. We got to see lots of the City and learn tons of interesting facts in about 3 hours. Derek was great - friendly and knowledgeable. The VW van was cool (literally because it does not have a heater, but was equipped with...


More  



My friend and I treated another friend for her birthday and San Francisco Love Tours didn't disappoint! Allen was our tour guide and he was a wealth of information. It was fun being in a fun VW van, it definitely gets attention with its moving mural!!
We are often in the city but this tour gave us golden nuggets that...


More  



It's fun when you can let your guard down and laugh with the tour guide. review_list:
Anton is passionate and wants to share a city he loves. It shows. I had an enjoyable day being introduced to various interesting spots which I would not have found on my own. It's always nice to have a local guiding you. And the food recommendations alone would have been worth the price tag 👍😉

Fully recommend making a San Francisco visit complete by partaking in at least one of the waking tours offered by this company.

My wife and I travel several times a year to different places it's been our best experience to have a guided tour then go exploring on our own.

Fun walking tour around Union Square and Chinatown with knowledgeable and quirky tour guide Fischer. We particularly liked the erhu shows and the alleys of Chinatown.

Absolutely awesome night walking tour of some of San Fransisco's darker past. Had never been to a wax museum before and was very surprised with how interactive it was. Had a great time and will probably go to another one now in the future.

title: Powell and Market Cable Car Turnaround, San Francisco
address: Powell and Market Streets, San Francisco, CA
review_list:
I've been here many times for many reasons, but it's always interesting: cool cable cars, of course, but also tourists and locals, office workers and street people, hipsters and buskers, and who knows who or what else in downtown San Francisco!

The cable cars are a great way to explore all of the different parts of the city. It was quite wet when we were in San Francisco, so the trams were an ideal way of getting around the city and exploring the different areas that we wanted to see. I would recommend buying a day pass, as the cable cars...


More  



Old cable trams and cars are always a fun thing to do. Unless you get on the stop before last and the ride lasts about 20 second and you are still being charged full price. I wish the ‘conductor’ have told us there was on point on getting on….

Cool to see how they turn around the cable cars but don't wait to get on here if there is any line. Each car pulls in a sits for 15 minutes before it leaves. Way slow.

The magical moment of Francisco seems almost always tops with the famous Cable Car rides ....Here is where the excitement starts and may become even more enticing at the end of the line that is if you dont mind waiting in lines for an hour or two sometimes.
Yet, even hanging on the side of the cable cars as it...


More  



Unless one had taken a ride in these iconic SF cable cars, one cannot claim one had visited SF! There are basically 3 cable car routes inoperation, Powell-Hyde, Powell-Mason and Powell-Market where the turntable is and also is the beginning stop for two of the line. We absolutely had a blast riding the cabie and were not about to do...


More  



Cable cars come and go frequently at this turnaround so it is unnecessary to wait long to watch one being turned manually by employees to face the opposite direction at the end of a run. I often stop for a look when I've exited the nearby Powell Street BART station or am returning to a hotel close-by. I find it...


More  



The cable car turn at the bottom of Powell St is worth seeing even if you don't take a ride on a car. In fact the queues here are always long so you may be better getting on elsewhere. But take a quick look at the old cars being turned on the turning circle. It's not something you get to...


More  



This is a great way of getting views and taking in SF in an efficient, as you travel to the other side of down-town at the same time. The lines can be a bit long but bear with it, it is worth the way. Front left is the best seat onboard in my opinion!

Definitely worth it if you are in SF. Avoid the Powell/Market St. turnaround and get on at California St/Market St. instead where the lines are much shorter - California St. takes you up to the top of Nob Hill (Fairmont Hotel; Mark Hopkins Intercontinental and Grace Cathedral) - or stay on to go down the other side of the hill...

title: Sutro Baths, San Francisco
review_list:
Quite amazing view of these salt water baths...interesting/different type of attraction, and certainly worth the visit if you are in the area.

Had it been a nicer day, we would have spent more time exploring the trails and walkways along the Sutro Baths. Amazing views regardless. Make sure you check out the picture of the Baths on the side of Louis Restaurant (located just above them) to fully appreciate what they would have looked like years ago.

Its a great place to visit. The baths are a pretty easy walk down but still takes you out to nature. It was raining when we went so it was very very wet and muddy. A lot of the area was covered by large pools of water which made some parts hard to get to, but you can still get...


More  



We had a great time at the Sutro Baths! The parking is free, we drove a few min but found a spot. The views are incredible, we got lucky with the weather too, it was a beautiful day! There's quite a few steps down to the baths, but it's fun to walk around and crawl on the ruins.

This place was not even on the itinerary when my friend and I made our list of things to see! It was thanks to our hotel receptionist at the Metro Hotel that we made a trek to this place.
I don't think photos can do this place enough justice. The view is spectacular during the day time, but if you...


More  



This is a spectacular spot on a clear day. The views are amazing and the crashing of the waves dramatic. Walking around the ruins and over to the point is not to be missed. Children will love the tunnel!

The trip is well worth the time and effort!
Plan to spend 1-2 hours near the baths. Go early for a less crowded experience as it can be very busy at peak times. A great place for quiet contemplation and imagining what the area would have looked like in it's hey day. Wear comfy shoes and layer up. Don't forget...


More  



Beautiful sightseeing spot. Ample of parking along the cost, easy to find parking on the day of our visit. Easy walking (hiking) along the way, enjoying beautiful view.
you can hike down all the way to the bottom, check out the "lands end" view up close and personal.
* can be windy and chill, bring a jacket.
* sunglasses a...


More  



Stunning! The area offers gorgeous views and a small hike nearby. The ruins are that of an ancient bath but it's the ocean view that's best here.

I lived in SF for 4 years and during that time never made it to the Sutro Baths. I'm glad I got my act together and went this last trip, such an interesting historical site. Very Instagram worthy, the ruins of this old bathhouse sit right on the ends of the earth with the sea breaking over them.
Wear comfortable...

title: San Francisco Symphony, San Francisco
address: 201 Van Ness Avenues, San Francisco, CA
review_list:
Emanuel Ax dazzled the audience with virtuosity on the Beethoven Piano Concerto #5 conducted by Krzysztof Urbansky. Dvorak Symphony #9 From the New World finished the night's performance with finesse and elegance.
This was my first visit and delighted in obtaining a last day ticket in the last row of the first tier; acoustics were fine & visual perspective impressive...


More  



As a world-renown orchestra, the San Francisco Symphony is a must-see / hear. One can experience favorite classics, a new masterpiece . . . or even a special event (i.e., Charlie Brown's holiday performance) -- and if nothing else, stop by the gift shop for a great souvenir. The service staff will take care of your detailed food and beverage...


More  



We saw the Charlie Brown Christmas which has a few different parts: first part includes Christmas carols played by the symphony, sung Christmas Carols sung by the San Francisco Chorus and guest artist Jodi Benson. The second half is the recreation of the Charlie Brown Christmas television series and a sing along. The Charlie Brown dancers were excellent as was...


More  



On my wedding night, instead of running off to our honeymoon, we chose something different - we went to the Symphony. The San Francisco Symphony was absolutely incredible! We chose seats that are usually occupied by a choir, which are behind the orchestra if the general public in the auditorium seats were watching the show. We sat behind the percussionist,...


More  



MTT and the San Francisco Symphony are terrific! We were lucky enough that our trip to San Francisco coincided with the SFS performance of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony!

Just a great experience even if you're like me and don't have much knowledge of classical music. The audience really gets into it.

What an amazing and unforgettable performance. So powerful. This was my first time at the symphony, I will definitely be going back.

Great performance of Fidelio. Michael Tilson Thomas was an awesome conductor and Nina Stemme and Brandon Jovanovich were outstanding. There were lots of chances to get really cheap tickets close to the actual event. Music - fantastic!

Beautiful building, wonderful acoustics, exciting programs. MTT is a City (if not a national) Treasure. If you are visiting, it's worth a ticket. If you live here, shame on you for not going as often as you can. SUPPORT THE ARTS!

The Symphony at it's best. I would recommend the San Francisco Symphony to any serious classical music fan.

title: Cliff House, San Francisco
review_list:
I often wonder why we don't eat here more often. Over the past few years, we have had many amazing dinners especially at sunset! The food is high quality, unique menu items, great wine list and not crazy expensive. Make a reservation 1/2 hour before Sunset - you won't be disappointed.

Great views of the pacific! However the food in the restaurant is way over priced for what you are getting. But worth going to see when hiking Lands End.

Great view and nice walk paths to walk. If you visit be careful where you park your car. I parked on the parking area in front of the visitors center, where it was apparently a safe area with a lot of people aroud. My car had a window broken and some articles stolen.
Visit with caution is My tip.

Food and service was great along with the views and atmosphere. Slightly pricey but all in all worth it.

My wife and I had lunch at this wonderful place. It was first-rate food and service with an amazing view! Must do it again next time we get to SF. Special indeed!!!

My wife and I were told if we had the time to go to Cliff House we should do it. Luckily, we did! I cannot give higher praise than Cliff House. It is a very romantic place if you get a view of the water. The food was wonderful and the wait staff were great. If you can get there...


More  



We visited Cliff House and the surrounding Land's End area as part of a bus tour and loved every minute of it. The area is amazing and the location of Cliff House is very good. It has observations decks, 2 restaurants & 2 bars and has a brilliant Sunday brunch where you can come and chill and just watch the...


More  



Unfortunately the Cliff house has become overrated due to it's great location and too many tourists. The food is so-so and not cheap.

Food was first rate. The pancakes were awesome. Service was top notch. The views, stunning!!! Windows everywhere so plenty of good seats to watch the ocean from. Could eat there every day.

great place to go for champagne Sunday brunch..good food and an awesome view of the water
They could use better bagels

title: Market Street Railway, San Francisco
review_list:
yes, it will get you where you need to go but it takes forever! Too many, too frequent stop, and speed is not simply there. Take a cab or walk.

It's great fun getting a ride on the street railway. Such a thrilling experience on multiple levels. For sure a must do when in town.

These old trams appearantly have been brought from many cities one countries. The are so bold that attract visitors eye every time they pass by.

45 minutes from the Golden Gate Parkway to the Embarcadero. 20 minutes by cab. Clean, comfortable, crowded on the holidays when we were there.

Perhaps if you're using these amazingly cared for and fun to use retro trams in off-peak periods, you'll have a great experience. However, we found the 'service' to be reliable early in the morning, but shocking on busy evenings.

title: Cliff House, San Francisco
review_list:
I often wonder why we don't eat here more often. Over the past few years, we have had many amazing dinners especially at sunset! The food is high quality, unique menu items, great wine list and not crazy expensive. Make a reservation 1/2 hour before Sunset - you won't be disappointed.

Great views of the pacific! However the food in the restaurant is way over priced for what you are getting. But worth going to see when hiking Lands End.

Great view and nice walk paths to walk. If you visit be careful where you park your car. I parked on the parking area in front of the visitors center, where it was apparently a safe area with a lot of people aroud. My car had a window broken and some articles stolen.
Visit with caution is My tip.

Food and service was great along with the views and atmosphere. Slightly pricey but all in all worth it.

My wife and I had lunch at this wonderful place. It was first-rate food and service with an amazing view! Must do it again next time we get to SF. Special indeed!!!

My wife and I were told if we had the time to go to Cliff House we should do it. Luckily, we did! I cannot give higher praise than Cliff House. It is a very romantic place if you get a view of the water. The food was wonderful and the wait staff were great. If you can get there...


More  



We visited Cliff House and the surrounding Land's End area as part of a bus tour and loved every minute of it. The area is amazing and the location of Cliff House is very good. It has observations decks, 2 restaurants & 2 bars and has a brilliant Sunday brunch where you can come and chill and just watch the...


More  



Unfortunately the Cliff house has become overrated due to it's great location and too many tourists. The food is so-so and not cheap.

Food was first rate. The pancakes were awesome. Service was top notch. The views, stunning!!! Windows everywhere so plenty of good seats to watch the ocean from. Could eat there every day.

great place to go for champagne Sunday brunch..good food and an awesome view of the water
They could use better bagels

title: Conservatory of Flowers, San Francisco
address: John F. Kennedy Drive, Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, CA 94118
review_list:

More  



One of the best flower conservatory I have seen. It's located inside Golden Gate Park. It have huge collection of orchid and other plants. If you like nature then definitely visit this Flower Conservatory.

The best conservatory I've seen. Not only does it have a great range of beautiful, interesting and thriving plants, but it is also cleverly and very creatively designed. More  



The conservatory is one of my most treasured places in all of SF. It is in Golden Gate Park, it was brought here in pieces from England and reassembled in the park. It has one of the best collection of tropical plants, orchids, and just so many more. I have been going there since I was five, and every time...


More  



Had a few hours set aside for a trip up to Golden State Park. The conservatory is divided by temperature and humidity - with some rooms being cooler and others being much more humid. Very interesting plants, very lush interior, excellent signage and descriptions.

I try to visit here every time I go to San Francisco. There is always a new exhibit every time I go. It's relatively cheap compared to some of the other museums at Golden Gate Park.

Great Pan Pacific Expo garden railway exhibit. Plus the Conservancy is a nice warm sport on a cool, dark San Francisco Winter day.

The layout is very pleasant and the plants are beautiful. But due to the limited horizontal space, it can feel a bit claustrophobic in some sections. Fortunately it didn't have too many visitors when we were there. So that wasn't too big an issue. The adjacent restrooms are in dire need of repair and update. (Most of the toilets are...


More  



What a lovely conservatory, imagine Kew or NY Botanical Garden on a tiny scale, but the same era. Gorgeous flowers, so peaceful, a perfect respite from the hustle of the city.

This was absolutely remarkable, worth the $6 beautiful spend an hour or two just basking in the flowers and the nature. I went on a rainy day

review_list:

Only worth it if you pay the extra $12 for a behind the scenes tour. If you do that you get way more for your money and really see everything!

Not the biggest of aquariums, but lovely and nice in it's own rite. I really enjoyed the amount of starfish they had on display and I loved the octopus. He was full of energy and fun to watch. They do have a area to touch bat rays and a shark.

Love this place so much love eating here love the scenes great things to take pictures of its awesome.

review_list:

Enjoy!

Lovely green space amid urban sprawl and chrome and glass towers surrounding it...definitely nice place to escape the concrete jungle.

We really liked this place. It offers great views of the buildings around the park, but it also gives you a piece of mind with the waterfall and green areas.
Nice place to visit anytime.

More  



Nice to escape here from the hustle and bustle of SF. Cafes and restaurants available. On different levels with some seating, waterfalls and scattered planting. Little shade.

More  



The Yerba Buena Gardens are a much needed green space in the heart of the concrete jungle of the city. Conveniently located and easy to walk to and enjoy. Lots of walking and relaxing room. Surrounded by shops, businesses and restaurants, so you've got it all. Enjoy. ...

After a busy day of shopping in Union Square, Yerba Buena Gardens is an oasis. There is grass to lie on and a Martin Luther King Memorial with a tranquil waterfall and many of his quotes etched into the walls. There are several restaurants and a children's playground surrounding it as well as a museum of Jewish art.

The Yerba Buena Gardens is a peaceful spot to relax and regroup in a hectic city. It's nice place for a stroll around and under the fountain or a picnic in the grass. I was impressed with the hydration station that allowed me to refill my water bottle,so environmentally friendly.

It offers plenty of area to walk around, see the skyscrapers, grab coffee, and play with things at the Metreon entertainment center. It also houses one of my favorite landmarks in the city, the Martin Luther King Memorial which...


More  



Nice to escape here from the hustle and bustle of SF. Cafes and restaurants available. On different levels with some seating, waterfalls and scattered planting. Little shade.

We met up with a City Guides tour at this location. It was nice and if I needed a place to sit down, this would be a good one. There were people gather and there is a coffee place. There is a museum across the street. I understand that there are a lot of performing arts here. I liked the...


More  



The Yerba Buena Gardens are a much needed green space in the heart of the concrete jungle of the city. Conveniently located and easy to walk to and enjoy. Lots of walking and relaxing room. Surrounded by shops, businesses and restaurants, so you've got it all. Enjoy. ...

After a busy day of shopping in Union Square, Yerba Buena Gardens is an oasis. There is grass to lie on and a Martin Luther King Memorial with a tranquil waterfall and many of his quotes etched into the walls. There are several restaurants and a children's playground surrounding it as well as a museum of Jewish art.

The Yerba Buena Gardens is a peaceful spot to relax and regroup in a hectic city. It's nice place for a stroll around and under the fountain or a picnic in the grass. I was impressed with the hydration station that allowed me to refill my water bottle,so environmentally friendly.

title: North Beach, San Francisco

I plan on spending at least an hour in there each time I visit. And it's a few doors down from the lovely Italian Pottery store, too. Great little store in North...


More  



I still correctly, or incorrectly, refer to SF's North Beach as the Italian area of town. At any rate there are a number of nice restaurants, Italian and otherwise, here as well as shops and boutiques galore. Fun to walk and explore. Think Dirty Harry? ...

North beach and Chinatown are next door neighbors. North beach is the place to rise and shine. Get some coffee and a sweet roll and walk/shop till lunch. Then you have some of the best places to choose from. CAN'T GO WRONG. The later evening and night life are a must do too. But there is NO BEACH at North...


More  



Staying near Union Square and going to Fishermans Wharf a lot we walked through this area a number of times and if we return will base ourselves here. Lots of local shops and bars you could really live like a local and still be near the tourist spots.

North Beach was a bit of a shock at first, after the tranquil, clean streets of Noe Valley, but after a day we got into the swing.

I really enjoy the North Beach area of San Francisco. It's filled with wonderful restaurants, many of them Italian, and bakeries with mouth watering pastries. The location is also great since it's right next door to Chinatown and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. A cable car ride or bus will get you to Union Square or anywhere else in the...


More  



Safest we've felt in the city. We saw no homeless people the entire afternoon. Saints Cathedral is gorgeous. Goorin Hat store is adorable! Service unmatched. Italian community is amazing with delicious eats. Smell of garlic in the air is fantastic! Lola novelty store is great for toys and specialty gifts. Enjoyed expanding views of the city from Coit Tower. Great...


More  



Oh what a place to be, to visit, to walk around and eat. Great pizza places, coffees shop... just need to be there and take a walk.
Drink some coffee and enjoy your time there.

Visited with family, toddlers, teens, and adults. Stopped on our bike ride from Fisherman's Wharf to the Golden Gate Bridge. Everyone had a great time. Water is cold, but a few kids got all of the way in. Plenty of space relax and admire the bay.

Easy to find. Located next to Chinatown. A nice place to talk a walk. Also a good place to eat Italian food.

title: San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park Ships at Hyde Street Pier, San Francisco
review_list:
My husband and I spent quite a while just on the pier reading the placards and discussing maritime history. We were unhurried and it made for a pleasant hour or 2 away from the bustle that is San Francisco. I wish we had paid to get on the vessels. Just to walk the pier and read and look at the...


More  



We're in San Francisco fairly often and this is a regular stop - ships are not fixed museum exhibits because they are always in some state of repair, minor or major because ships age.
Not unlike active vessels, they have to be painted, caulked and sometimes effectively rebuilt.
We watched for years as the Balclutha was rebuilt into the beautiful...


More  



The park service has done a wonderful job maintaining the ships and ambience. Further, the free cell phone narratives are great. HOWEVER, the experience was completely ruined by several dozen school children. No only were they not disciplined by their teachers and chaperones for yelling and running, the park guide giving the tour was also not in control of the...


More  



Tip of the Day. If you have a National Parks Pass bring it. It will allow you to do the ship tours for free. The Museum is really cool. Nice to hold hands and walk along the ocean.

I walked down the pier only. I didn't have time to board the ships. The pier is free & offers photo ops. The San Diego collection more interesting. however ship collection is good value for the price. The Visitor center across from the pier is excellent, free & a must visit. It also has clean toilets.

Near Fisherman's Wharf many old sailing ships museum parks walking distance to everything if you love old ships you will love the San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park at Hyde Street Pier if old ships are not your thing just walk a little further so much to see and do in San Francisco

We stumbled upon this park while walking from Fisherman's Warf to the Ghirardelli Chocolate Factory for sundaes. The exhibit boasts beautiful light house lights and interesting artifacts. We did not have time to visit the ships on the dock---intriguing and beautiful. If you are a ship person and a history buff, this is a must stop for you. The entrance...


More  



Fabulous ships at Hyde park pier, very friendly and helpful national parks guides, but do not miss sailing on the alma! Highlight of our trip. Crewed by knowledgable and friendly volunteers, we set sail with our park range guide and had a fantastic experience sailing the bay, going under the bridge. Got some hands on experience too and learned about...


More  



If you love old fashioned ships, this is for you. From what i can remember it was really cheap to enter the museum too, like $5. Big steel sailing ship and tug boats as well as an old paddle boat made for really good photos and a nice day out. Plenty going on in near by streets to see too..

Docked by the bay. Free to go right next to both of them to take photos also tours are available and there is a free museum . They display some part of the ship like the engine and also some bombs. Also detailed map of the ship and submarine. Well worth a visit.

title: Orpheum Theatre, San Francisco
review_list:
Attended the Jersey Boys performance last Sunday and strained mightily to hear the dialogue and songs of the performers. First I thought it was only me but when I asked my friends, they were experiencing the same thing. We were seated on the balcony level but in the first row looking directly at center stage. There's no reason for such...


More  



Went to see Jersey Boys in this beautiful setting. Sound was fine, despite other complaints.
Had Orchestra seats row P and were perfect for this wonderful musical.
A walk down Market, but in afternoon matinee, was fine. Plenty of time for nice dinner after!

Phantom of the Opera was intense. I have read some negative reviews due to the sound quality, but I had no problems. This local theater is a true treasure for the community and those traveling through.

Always hosting great shows and generally they crowd and staff make for a great experience. Rarely if ever have I had issues with the Orpheum. If I have to say any place for improvement is on occasion the sound is off. Like many of the old theaters that can always be a challenge.

By far the worst sound system I have heard in a theater. I've been many times and will not go again. At the intermissions of both National companies of MATILDA and IF/THEN, all I heard was "Do you understand anything they are saying or singing?" I suppose if I were in the front orchestra I might get a better grip...


More  



Just saw phantom of the opera here and really enjoyed the play as well as the theater. The music was great and the theater was very fitting.

We have seen everything here from West Side Story to Wicked to Once. It is a gorgeous theater with excellent traveling companies.

Local theaters are a dying breed in SF and elsewhere. This is a fine theater with a checkerboard of good and mediocre programming. If there is a current showing of something that interests you, then please go to this venue that was once one of the anchors is a terrific local theater district,

Went to see If/Then with Idina Menzel and it was a great experience. The neighborhood does not showcase SF at its best. Found parking close by and discovered there is a BART station nearby so will try that next time.
Had seats in the mezzanine and was able to see very well and the sound system was good. Ladies room...


More  



The Orpheum in San Francosco is one of the most gorgeous theatres I've been to. Went November 28 for the play "If / Then" with Idina Menzel. The staff that works at Orpheum are kind and well informed. They make the time spent there really nice. Parking was a couple blocks away across street. Loved it!

I prefer Telegraph hill compared to Twin peaks, you come closer to the "action" on Telegraph Hills. Stunning views over the docks, Alcatraz, the bay and Golden Gate.

it is definitely a must see attraction while you in sf, we were at sunset, which was spectacular from the top of the hill

title: Mission District, San Francisco
address: Mission St. between 16th and Army Sts., San Francisco, CA
review_list:
If it's diversity you're looking for.. the Mission District is the place to find it. ANY kind of restaurant can be found in this area. We ate at a Vietnamese restaurant (MAU) & authentic Turkish (TUBA) restaurant and also saw a newly opened GUAM restaurant. Lots of small, great tavernas and other great authentic eateries. It's a people watcher's paradise..You...


More  



May be it´s because I´m latin, but I couldn´t find the special thing about this place. There are some good graffittis though. The area looks quite dodgy, I guess at night it´s not a nice place to be walking by.

The Mission District, on New year's day, was a ghost town with no evidences of hippest, lively, high rent neighborhood. There were a handful cafes opened and a large crowd gathered for warmth and cafeine in a big popular artisanal cafe. Homeless were prowling and begging on the streets which were littered with garbages or leftovers from the night before....


More  



I visited the Mission District to take in the Dia De Los Muertos holiday while staying in San Francisco. We caught the train up and was greeted to Salsa music and some small market stalls with locals loitering. The architecture, and the murals are what stood out for me and you can see how the area is becoming gentrified over...


More  



The Mission District has it all. It is one of San Francisco's most colorful, interesting, and diverse neighborhoods. Restaurants of all types. Latino culture everywhere. Interesting coffee shops, colorful alleys with murals. But, it's also quite dangerous at times. Aggressive homelessness and drugs openly for sale near the BART stations. An occasional shooting.

We mostly visited because of Mission Dolores and we didn't like what we saw at all.
There was no one in the streets aside from us and a few demented homeless people who were screaming nonsense at us. We felt terribly unsafe... I would definitely skip this neighbourhood even more so if alone or with family...

There is no block with an excellent restaurant. Most places look like dumps from the outside. Do not be fooled! Food options are superb and absolutely delicious. The Mission District is covered with art. Starting from gulley covers, up the walls and pretty much every corner. It is the perfect place for a stroll on a sunny San Francisco day....


More  



Yep, this will not be a popular review but I do not like bitter art. That is the type of art that is created out of some bitterness one has. Protest art is a form of bitter art. Folks like this are never happy, and are always bitter at their situation. That was the primary art I saw here in...


More  



We arrived mid-afternoon on a sunny winter day and took in the sites, sounds, shopping and dining available in the neighborhood. We always enjoy seeing the variety of city life on display in this Hipster and Latino area and on this visit took more time to take in the street art wall murals before dinner at Bar Tartine. Of course...


More  



Take a stroll down Valencia for some great shops and restaurants. This part of town is full of hipsters, so expect to pay some premium prices. Mission Street is also cool with more of a Latino influence.

title: Fort Funston, San Francisco
address: Off Skyline Blvd. (Part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area), San Francisco, CA
review_list:
Fort Funston is on the Pacific Ocean side, at the southern edge of San Francisco. It is very easily accessible, there are bus lines, and by car, you can reach it in record time, because of easy access from the highway. It is serene, with amazing cliff views, locals come here to walk their dogs and wing surf. There is...


More  



This is an excellent bike ride away from the South end of Golden Gate Park. The rid his mostly uphill, but not very steep (the return ride is really fun!).
There are great views of the Pacific ocean and hang gliders hovering overhead.
There's a trial that's about a quarter mile down to the beautiful beach, which doesn't seem to...


More  



Beautiful spot by the ocean favored by hang gliders. We had a lot of fun watching the hang gliders gliding above us, and coming in to land. This must be a great site for taking wedding pictures as we saw two parties there.

OH MY! Best time for my little doggie! A off leash heaven for my doggie and a haven for us handlers. My doggie loves this place with it's amazing smells and FREEDOM! The views are incredible and the patrons are lovely. The best place for my doggie and I!

Came here for a quick stop to see the hang gliders. Not many hang gliders, but lots of friendly dogs, families and stunning views. Make time for at least a quick stop here to gaze out over the ocean.

You can run your dog off leash on the sand dunes or down on the beach here. Views for the humans are great too. Water loving dogs will especially love Fort Funston. Bring towels. Watch out for rip tides.

While this beach is a bit of a hike to get to and it's probably not the right destination for the lesser-abled. If you have a dog and like "long walks on the beach" you must bring your pup here! It's the most dog friendly beach in the city. I'll see you there!

Great place to take your dog or kids on a nice sunny day. Beautiful views and friendly people. Bring your kite and a picnic basket.

We had been at the beach before and really enjoyed the views from the bluffs and the walk on the beach. This time we were visiting and had our dog. I did not know what to expect since this was the first time that we have had Riley off-leash. It was a joyful experience enjoying the ocean and watching our...


More  



We actually went to see the Hang gliders. However, due to weather conditions there were none.. The fort had great world war 2 history and great views if beach and ocean. Lots of Dogs

title: The San Francisco Dungeon, San Francisco
review_list:
My husband and my 23 year old son went to this last February while visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area. We had stumbled onto the attraction and found that this was one of the highlights of our weekend stay in the Bay area! The actors were spot on - they engaged with the audience. Extremely entertaining. I don't know how they...

I’m a fan of the dungeons in London so thought I’d give this one a go. Purchased the discounted early tickets (use before 5pm) on the day of my visit. I was alone and there was one other group of 3 people so there wasn’t a lot of group ‘atmosphere’ so to speak. But the actors did their best to...


More  



Def not what i was expecting. I thought there would be more stories and historical information. The effects were amazing and the actors did a great job too. They did a lot to involve the guests as well.

The Dungeon is a unique twist on San Francisco history. The tour provides a theatrical version to entertain as well as inform. The event would be good for families as well as individuals who visit San Francisco and the Fisherman's Warf tourist area of California's beloved city.

Way more fun than we anticipated! We were optimistic going in but the experience really exceeded our expectations. Would totally do it again!

I expected to find dimly lit hallways and dark creatures jumping out at me but despite my disappointment that I didn't jump out of my skin I learned a great deal about the City of San Francisco. I quite enjoyed the dungeons. Without ruining the experience, each person portrayed added character to the history of the town. Reasonably priced and...


More  



I must say we did this on the spur of the moment. We had the San Francisco GO cards and needed to do one more activity!! Walked past and thought we'd see what it was. Around 45mins long, we had a great walking tour of various rooms set up depicitng significant and slightly barbaric historical SF events. It was great!...


More  



I didn't exactly know what to expect with The San Francisco Dungeon. I didn't know if it would be mercilessly horrifying, 'outstandingly' cheesy or something else.

You can run your dog off leash on the sand dunes or down on the beach here. Views for the humans are great too. Water loving dogs will especially love Fort Funston. Bring towels. Watch out for rip tides.

While this beach is a bit of a hike to get to and it's probably not the right destination for the lesser-abled. If you have a dog and like "long walks on the beach" you must bring your pup here! It's the most dog friendly beach in the city. I'll see you there!

Great place to take your dog or kids on a nice sunny day. Beautiful views and friendly people. Bring your kite and a picnic basket.

We had been at the beach before and really enjoyed the views from the bluffs and the walk on the beach. This time we were visiting and had our dog. I did not know what to expect since this was the first time that we have had Riley off-leash. It was a joyful experience enjoying the ocean and watching our...


More  



We actually went to see the Hang gliders. However, due to weather conditions there were none.. The fort had great world war 2 history and great views if beach and ocean. Lots of Dogs

title: Market Street, San Francisco
review_list:
We really enjoyed all the places to visit in San Francisco. Riding the street cars was a unique experience. You could get around most of the city this way. We mostly walked to see the attractions..

Market Street is not monolithic and contains so much! Fancy hotels, stores, malls, and restaurants, yet also homeless people, junk stores, and piss. There's also Twitter HQ, chess players, small shops, markets, lots of people, cafes, and the unique serendipity of San Francisco!

Name the store, and likely it's here. Want to see the myriad showcase of visitors and locals and walk through the throngs going hither and yon, this is the place. Lots to see, buy and experience.

We walked down Market Street after eating breakfast at Mels Diner. It seems to go forever from China Town through the financial district all the way to the water.Nice walk plenty of places to stop, eat and drink.

Market Street runs for about three miles between the SF Bay at Embarcadero to Twin Peaks, passing through many areas, including the Civic Center and the Castro District. It has everything from good shopping to homeless wandering its sidewalks. At some point during my visits to the city, I find myself on Market, usually between Powell and the Embarcadero. That's...


More  



We find ourselves going to Market Street Area often. There is the shopping area (Westfield Mall, etc.) in Union Square area. When one walks east to the end, one finds the Ferry Building. There is also the Civic Center area, as well as the Montgormery District. This is the financial district area
Bart (Bay Area Rapid Transit), the bus (San...


More  



Market St is an important thoroughfare and a major transit artery in SF. The heritage streetcars, F Market line, buses, trollybuses share this street whilst 2 levels below runs the Market St subway carrying Metro and BART. Sadly, Market St today is dirty, gritty, urine-smelling and homeless milling around begging. We surfaced from BART totge Visitor Information Center and from...


More  



I stay in SF regularly for business and I don't think I will ever get used to seeing all the homeless, mentally ill and drug-abused souls on Market St. For anyone visiting from elsewhere it is shocking yet obviously seems very normal to those who live here.
Yes, Market St has got the good Norstram shopping centre and nice shops...


More  



Yes, there are some good parts of Market Street (like 3 blocks) but the rest is seriously awful! Full of homeless people, mainly crazy and shouting things, lots of drug use and dealing, pee and human feces in the street...
From Market and 12th street up to Market and 6th... I was scared for my life... I've never felt so...


More  



If you are in the need of feeling the rush of a big City like NY, Market street has plenty of it, busy street, with tall office buildings, street artist, crowded sidewalk with fast paced people walking around and many shops around will make you feel like you are ready to invest in the newest IT startup.

title: The San Francisco Dungeon, San Francisco
review_list:
My husband and my 23 year old son went to this last February while visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area. We had stumbled onto the attraction and found that this was one of the highlights of our weekend stay in the Bay area! The actors were spot on - they engaged with the audience. Extremely entertaining. I don't know how they...


More  



I’m a fan of the dungeons in London so thought I’d give this one a go. Purchased the discounted early tickets (use before 5pm) on the day of my visit. I was alone and there was one other group of 3 people so there wasn’t a lot of group ‘atmosphere’ so to speak. But the actors did their best to...


More  



Def not what i was expecting. I thought there would be more stories and historical information. The effects were amazing and the actors did a great job too. They did a lot to involve the guests as well.

The Dungeon is a unique twist on San Francisco history. The tour provides a theatrical version to entertain as well as inform. The event would be good for families as well as individuals who visit San Francisco and the Fisherman's Warf tourist area of California's beloved city.

Way more fun than we anticipated! We were optimistic going in but the experience really exceeded our expectations. Would totally do it again!

I expected to find dimly lit hallways and dark creatures jumping out at me but despite my disappointment that I didn't jump out of my skin I learned a great deal about the City of San Francisco. I quite enjoyed the dungeons. Without ruining the experience, each person portrayed added character to the history of the town. Reasonably priced and...


More  



I must say we did this on the spur of the moment. We had the San Francisco GO cards and needed to do one more activity!! Walked past and thought we'd see what it was. Around 45mins long, we had a great walking tour of various rooms set up depicitng significant and slightly barbaric historical SF events. It was great!...


More  



I didn't exactly know what to expect with The San Francisco Dungeon. I didn't know if it would be mercilessly horrifying, 'outstandingly' cheesy or something else.
Truth is, it's neither of those things. I'll get straight to the point. If you are looking for an 'Exorcist-like' scare, this is NOT it. The Dungeon is not designed for those with an...


More  



Good acting
Good effects
Got free tickets from big bus tours
Well done using basement space.
Hope they do well
End photo album was expensive
I'm sure they will get the mix right

I took my 12 year old son and my 50+ parents and we all loved it! The performers were great! They chose my son and me to interact in the judges room and it was hysterical! The gentleman that took us into the elevator was great throughout. The "scares" we're great and surprising. The sets were well done and complete....


More

title: Mission Dolores, San Francisco
address: 3321 Sixteenth Street, Mission District, San Francisco, CA 94114
review_list:
A chapel, basilica and cemetery. When we were there they still had the Christmas decorations on display. Worth a visit if you happen to be in the area.

I was seriously excited to visit this church (being a Hitchcock fan) which is why I am mad that it was such a let-down.
The neighbourhood is really quiet but it was also (at the time of our visit, which was in the late afternoon) very much dead. The people that were walking around seemed shady and being an important...


More  



Old mission cathedral worth a visit. Do not miss the garden and historical cemetery outside. Make sure to see the litle original old mission as well as the newer cathedral.

The California missions are a part of US history that isn't as familiar to those of us educated on the east coast. I was in San Francisco for business and took the opportunity to stop in at the Mission when I had a spare hour in the afternoon. The Mission is beautiful, as is the Basilica. The tour was $5...


More  



Made it a point to visit here this trip as I had missed it on previous trips. It is a beautiful church, basilica. There is a little museum off the courtyard with artifacts from when this was an old mission. There is also an old cemetery in the back. Lots to see in a peaceful, relaxed setting. The organist was...


More  



Hard to imagine that an old Spanish mission here was the foundation of what would become San Francisco. Harder still to fathom is that this was in 1776 when lots was going on at the newly civilized east coast. A treasure to see, enjoy and to learn more about Spanish colonial California! ...

Saturday vigil mass is at 5 pm in the Mission church. It's impressive to imagine Mass being celebrated here since 1776. Inside the church is colorful, with plenty of statutes of saints to look at. The Basilica church next door is beautiful.

Went for Mass on a Sunday morning, lovely enthusiastic priest. Not many parishioners joined in with the singing which was a shame, beautiful hymns. Nobody welcomed me afterwards though.

Visiting Mission Dolores is like stepping back in time. The oldest part of the mission is one of the more important historical places to visit when in San Francisco, and is well worth a visit if it is your first time in the city.

Easy to find. Can be accessed via the street cars. There is a fee charged to access the property. Worth visiting.

title: Russian Hill, San Francisco
address: Bounded by Broadway, Polk and Lombard Sts., San Francisco, CA
review_list:
A very short street, gets its' name from the Russian sailors' graves that were found there. Basically - a landmark and place to take some photos from a high vantage point. Very nice residential houses.

Russian Hill is a beautiful part of the City with magnificent views of the Bay and the City. Of course, Coit Tower is a must see. Take the free cityguides tour to see the second floor of murals in the tower- not always open otherwise! The best thing to do is just walk. There are lots of small streets, stairways...


More  



Beautiful neighborhood and typically san francisco hills. Do not miss the coit tower up in russian hill. Great piece of art and catch the parrots in the trees around the tower, featured in the movie "the parrots of telegraph hill"

Great views of the bay, great pizza and ice cream joints, what is there not to like about Russian Hill? Go there to catch a perfect view of Alcatraz!

The Russian Hill district is another of San Francisco's many named areas. You'll likely climb it when doing the Lombard Street circuit or otherwise. The district has splendid houses, restaurants and a few shops & boutiques. Some great bay and city views as well. ...

I decided to do a walk up to Grace Cathedral on one of my days in San Francisco because I needed a good hard challenging walk. You'll get that if you come here. Lots of steep hills to walk. However, I got very distracted on my trip to Grace Cathedral just wandering around the area looking at the beautiful houses....


More  



Such a beautiful area to visit when in San Francisco! Many different restaurants and attractions. And if you want a real good workout, walking or running up and down the hills is a mighty task!

The Russian Hill area is one of the steepest areas of San Francisco. You must experience the steep inclines.

Love this area for the cafes, coffee shops, Russian Hill Bookstore, hardware store, just the enjoyable walk ability of this area.

Because of California’s perpetual drought, there’s no pail of water for J&J to fetch atop this hill. Like Fisherman’s Wharf and Chinatown, Russian Hill is one of the 44 San Francisco districts. The titular “hill” is crested by Hyde Street, on which I used a cable car to get to Lombard Street—SF’s iconic street that has more twists and turns...

title: San Francisco Ballet, San Francisco
address: 401 Van Ness Ave, (between McAllister and Fell Sts), San Francisco, CA 94102
review_list:
A fantastic SF version of the Nutcraker. We had seats really high up on the center balcony, but there were no issues seeing anything on stage. The show was amazing, we hope to come again!

This is the first time I've seen a nutcracker other than the Mark Morris version when I didn't think, why am I doing this Again? SF Ballet has been getting better and better for the past 10 years and It's hard to imagine, certainly of the men, the troupe getting any better. Wonderful hall.

We try to go to SF Ballet when we are in town. The Nutcracker is a must see. This time we saw Romeo and Juliet and splurged for 2nd row orchestra. Great seats and able to order without a season ticket. The Opera House is spectacular and worth taking the time to see.

We saw Don Quixote and were blown away by the best performance we have seen. They do a lot of "modern" ballet which is not my cup of tea...but the traditional dances are must sees in my book. Recommend dining at the buffet before the performance...they can set up your table for desert and appertifs during intermission. Dash for the...


More  



An avid ballet lover, I did not have plans to attend the SF ballet on my quick weekend trip, until I saw the posters for Don Quixote. My husband and I called and were able to get tickets for a Saturday night in March.
This was a highlight of my trip! The Opera House was a beautiful setting for this...


More  



The auditorium at the War Memorial Opera House is beautiful. I sat in the dress circle for a performance of "Dances at s Gathering" and "Hummingbird." Highly recommended for fans of ballet.

A must see...I recommend Box Seating. It isn't that much money given the experience and the show is incredible.

SFB School year end performance. Amazing talent for such young dancers! Cannot wait to see the SFB itself

The theater is a beautiful place to visit; the company has excellent dancers, both principal and corps, and there is more snow on the stage than you will see in your backyard in the average winter in Maryland. We had all the Christmas-spirit experience we hoped for.

I am a ballet lover and I have seen ballet companies perform all over the world. We are fortunate to have such an excellent ballet company in San Francisco. I have had season tickets now for many years. The range is great. Helgi Tomasson, the artistic director, has created a company with wonderful dancers from all over the world. We...
